product_overview: SecureBank API is a production-grade RESTful banking transaction system built on Spring Boot 3.x that supports secure user authentication, account management, deposit/withdrawal/transfer transactions, and administrative controls. It provides a robust and scalable API backend integrating JWT security, comprehensive logging, and enterprise-grade transaction consistency.
core_goals: Provide secure and seamless user registration and authentication with JWT token handling.
Enable users to create, view, and manage multiple account types with real-time balance and statements.
Support atomic banking transactions including deposits, withdrawals, and transfers with ACID compliance.
Implement robust admin controls for managing users, accounts, transactions, and audit logs.
Ensure security best practices including role-based access, password encryption, and audit logging.
Deliver a scalable and containerized architecture optimized for modern cloud deployments.
key_features: User registration and login with JWT authentication and profile retrieval.
Account creation supporting savings and current account types, with balance checking and statement retrieval.
Transaction processing supporting deposit, withdrawal, and inter-account transfers with transaction fees and daily limits.
Admin interface endpoints to view all users, accounts, and transactions and to freeze or unfreeze accounts.
Comprehensive audit logging of critical operations for security and compliance purposes.
RESTful API documentation via Swagger/OpenAPI for easy integration.
Docker Compose support for quick deployment and testing.
Integrated unit and integration testing setup for high code quality.
Security features including BCrypt password hashing, SQL injection protection via ORM, and role-based access control.
user_flow_summary: User registers with username, email, and personal details and receives a JWT token.
User logs in using credentials and obtains JWT token for authenticating further API calls.
User creates a new bank account specifying account type and currency.
User retrieves list of their accounts with current balances.
User performs deposits, withdrawals, and transfers of funds via secure endpoints.
User views detailed account statements and transaction histories.
Admin logs in with elevated privileges to review users, accounts, and transactions.
Admin freezes or unfreezes user accounts as needed for security or compliance.
Admin generates daily reports and audits transaction logs for monitoring.
validation_criteria: User registration validates required fields and returns a JWT token upon success.
Login endpoint authenticates credentials and returns valid JWT tokens with proper roles.
Account creation requires account type and currency and returns account details on success.
Balance retrieval endpoints return accurate real-time balances without delay.
Transaction endpoints enforce daily limits, minimum balance rules, and apply transaction fees consistently.
Admin endpoints correctly restrict access to authorized roles only.
Audit logs are complete and accurately record user actions with timestamps and details.
API endpoints respond with appropriate HTTP status codes and success indicators.
Comprehensive unit and integration tests cover at least 85% code with mocking and container-based database integration.
Docker images successfully build and run with all services accessible per documented URLs.

features.name: Authentication API
features.description: Handles user registration, login, and retrieving current user information

features.name: Account API
features.description: Handles account creation, retrieval, balance, and statements

features.name: Transaction API
features.description: Handles deposits, withdrawals, transfers, and transaction history

features.name: Admin API
features.description: Admin endpoints for managing users, accounts, transactions, and reports
